page.title: 04TAKELEY, THE PEOPLE
page.content: Over the past fifty years, there has been a great change in the composition of the population of Takeley and the surrounding villages. This has had a great effect on the villagers' occupations and place of work. In the past most of the people worked in agriculture or local service, both domestic and commercial. Therefore they lived and worked within the community. Now the majority of people work outside the village, either in surrounding towns such as Bishops Stortford and Harlow, or further afield in the City of London. People commute from the village daily either by car, train or coach. The arrival of London's third airport at Stansted may again change the whole pattern of the population and place of work.This may once again produce a community where people both live and work.
